text: Judge the meaning, utility, and reasonableness of the results of symbol manipulations, including those carried out by technology.

title: Algebra
text: Identify essential quantitative relationships in a situation and determine the class or classes of functions that might model the relationships;

title: Algebra
text: Use symbolic expressions, including iterative and recursive forms, to represent relationships arising from various contexts;

title: Algebra
text: Draw reasonable conclusions about a situation being modeled.

title: Algebra
text: Approximate and interpret rates of change from graphical and numerical data.

title: Geometry
text: Analyze properties and determine attributes of two- and three-dimensional objects;

title: Geometry
text: Explore relationships (including congruence and similarity) among classes of two- and three-dimensional geometric objects, make and test conjectures about them, and solve problems involving them;

title: Geometry
text: Establish the validity of geometric conjectures using deduction, prove theorems, and critique arguments made by others;

title: Geometry
text: Use trigonometric relationships to determine lengths and angle measures.

title: Geometry
text: Use Cartesian coordinates and other coordinate systems, such as navigational, polar, or spherical systems, to analyze geometric situations;

title: Geometry
text: Investigate conjectures and solve problems involving two- and three-dimensional objects represented with Cartesian coordinates.

title: Geometry
text: Understand and represent translations, reflections, rotations, and dilations of objects in the plane by using sketches, coordinates, vectors, function notation, and matrices;

title: Geometry
text: Use various representations to help understand the effects of simple transformations and their compositions.

title: Geometry
text: Draw and construct representations of two- and three-dimensional geometric objects using a variety of tools;

title: Geometry
text: Visualize three-dimensional objects and spaces from different perspectives and analyze their cross sections;

title: Geometry
text: Use vertex-edge graphs to model and solve problems;

title: Geometry
text: Use geometric models to gain insights into, and answer questions in, other areas of mathematics;

title: Geometry
text: Use geometric ideas to solve problems in, and gain insights into, other disciplines and other areas of interest such as art and architecture.

title: Measurement
text: Make decisions about units and scales that are appropriate for problem situations involving measurement.

title: Measurement
text: Analyze precision, accuracy, and approximate error in measurement situations;

title: Measurement
text: Understand and use formulas for the area, surface area, and volume of geometric figures, including cones, spheres, and cylinders;

title: Measurement
text: Apply informal concepts of successive approximation, upper and lower bounds, and limit in measurement situations;

title: Measurement
text: Use unit analysis to check measurement computations.

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand the differences among various kinds of studies and which types of inferences can legitimately be drawn from each;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Know the characteristics of well-designed studies, including the role of randomization in surveys and experiments;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand the meaning of measurement data and categorical data, of univariate and bivariate data, and of the term variable;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand histograms, parallel box plots, and scatterplots and use them to display data;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Compute basic statistics and understand the distinction between a statistic and a parameter.

title: Analysis and Probability
text: For univariate measurement data, be able to display the distribution, describe its shape, and select and calculate summary statistics;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: For bivariate measurement data, be able to display a scatterplot, describe its shape, and determine regression coefficients, regression equations, and correlation coefficients using technological tools;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Display and discuss bivariate data where at least one variable is categorical;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Recognize how linear transformations of univariate data affect shape, center, and spread;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Identify trends in bivariate data and find functions that model the data or transform the data so that they can be modeled.

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Use simulations to explore the variability of sample statistics from a known population and to construct sampling distributions;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand how sample statistics reflect the values of population parameters and use sampling distributions as the basis for informal inference;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Evaluate published reports that are based on data by examining the design of the study, the appropriateness of the data analysis, and the validity of conclusions;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand how basic statistical techniques are used to monitor process characteristics in the workplace.

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand the concepts of sample space and probability distribution and construct sample spaces and distributions in simple cases;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Use simulations to construct empirical probability distributions;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Compute and interpret the expected value of random variables in simple cases;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand the concepts of conditional probability and independent events;

title: Analysis and Probability
text: Understand how to compute the probability of a compound event.

title: Problem Solving
text: Build new mathematical knowledge through problem solving;

title: Problem Solving
text: Solve problems that arise in mathematics and in other contexts;

title: Problem Solving
text: Apply and adapt a variety of appropriate strategies to solve problems;

title: Problem Solving
text: Monitor and reflect on the process of mathematical problem solving.

title: Reasoning and Proof
text: Recognize reasoning and proof as fundamental aspects of mathematics;

title: Reasoning and Proof
text: Make and investigate mathematical conjectures;

title: Reasoning and Proof
text: Develop and evaluate mathematical arguments and proofs;

title: Reasoning and Proof
text: Select and use various types of reasoning and methods of proof.

title: Communication
text: Organize and consolidate their mathematical thinking through communication;

title: Communication
text: Communicate their mathematical thinking coherently and clearly to peers, teachers and others;

title: Communication
text: Analyze and evaluate the mathematical thinking and strategies of others;

title: Communication
text: Use the language of mathematics to express mathematical ideas precisely.

title: Connection
text: Recognize and use connections among mathematical ideas;

title: Connection
text: Understand how mathematical ideas interconnect and build on one another to produce a coherent whole;

title: Connection
text: Recognize and apply mathematics in contexts outside of mathematics.

text: Create and use representations to organize, record and communicate mathematical ideas;
